solution_line_template: Three-quarters of oil from the initially full {initial_tank_capacity}-liter tank would be {initial_tank_capacity}*({fraction_numerator}/{fraction_denominator})= <<{initial_tank_capacity}*{fraction_numerator}/{fraction_denominator}={oil_poured}>>{oil_poured} liters

In addition to the {initial_oil_in_tanker} liters that were already in the large tanker, there are {initial_oil_in_tanker}+{oil_poured} = <<{initial_oil_in_tanker}+{oil_poured}={current_oil_in_tanker}>>{current_oil_in_tanker} liters in it now.

The tanker would be filled to half capacity by ({half_capacity_numerator}/{half_capacity_denominator})*{tanker_capacity} = <<({half_capacity_numerator}/{half_capacity_denominator})*{tanker_capacity}={half_tanker_capacity}>>{half_tanker_capacity} liters of oil
There are {half_tanker_capacity}-{current_oil_in_tanker} = <<{half_tanker_capacity}-{current_oil_in_tanker}={liters_needed}>>{liters_needed} liters left to reach half capacity.
